thread.title: Caitlyn Jenner won't be charged over California car crash
thread.title_full: Caitlyn Jenner won't be charged over California car crash

title: Caitlyn Jenner won't be charged over California car crash
text:
Caitlyn Jenner won't be charged over California car crash Caitlyn Jenner won't be charged over California car crash 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Caitlyn Jenner will not be charged over a California car crash that led to the death of another driver, prosecutors in Los Angeles have decided. 
They say there is not enough evidence for a conviction. (Cindy Yamanaka/AP) 
Officials said Caitlyn was towing an off-road vehicle on a trailer behind a Cadillac Escalade on February 7 when she crashed into two cars, pushing one into oncoming traffic. Driver Kim Howe was killed when her Lexus was hit by a Hummer. 
“We believed from the start that a thorough and objective investigation would clear Caitlyn of any criminal wrongdoing,” said Blair Berk, Caitlyn’s lawyer. 
“We are heartened the district attorney has agreed that even a misdemeanour charge would be inappropriate. A traffic accident, however devastating and heartbreaking when a life is lost, is not necessarily a criminal matter.” 
The accident occurred before Caitlyn announced she is transgender and transitioned into her new identity. (Chris Pizzello/AP) 
Sheriff’s investigators previously determined that Caitlyn was travelling at an unsafe speed for the road conditions and there was enough evidence to support a vehicular manslaughter charge. The case was then referred to the district attorney’s major crimes division. 
After the accident, she released a statement expressing sympathy to everyone involved in the accident. 
“It is a devastating tragedy,” the statement read. “I cannot pretend to imagine what this family is going through at this time. I am praying for them.” Share article 
Caitlyn is facing separate lawsuits by Ms Howe’s stepchildren and the driver of the other car involved in the collision. Promoted Stories
